instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on after several minutes
threads.message:
Hello everybody.

The macbook had liquid damage around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, it was changed for a donor but, there are problems in power on.

When I try to turn it on, it marks me as having no battery and after 15-20 minutes of letting it charge, it turns on with + 50% battery. The failure is random since there are times when it turns on the first time.

What do I check?

Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on after several minutes
threads.message:
Does it turn on without battery connected?
Check <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> level.
Be sure to use proper charger...
